text: Phyo Gyi (; ; born 25 January 1979) is a Burmese singer and musician. He is known for his contributions to pop music in Myanmar. He started his career in the early 2000s and has released many albums and songs. == Early life == Phyo Gyi was born as Phyo Myint Ngwe on 25 January 1979 in Yangon, Myanmar. He studied Botany before he became a musician. == Career == Phyo Gyi started his music career in 2001 as a member of the group 102.7FM. He released two albums with the group: San Da in 2001 and Tha Chin Chit Thu in 2002. In 2003, he released his first solo album, A Thin Chay. Over the years, he has made many hit songs and worked with other famous artists. In 2012, he released his second solo album, Ma Mone Kyaye. He has performed in concerts and music festivals across Myanmar. == Discography == === Studio albums === # San Da (with 102.7FM, 2001) # Tha Chin Chit Thu (with 102.7FM, 2002) # A Thin Chay (2003) # Ma Mone Kyaye (2012) # My Everything (2018) # Ma Mae Naing (2023) # Nauk Htaung A Chit (2025) === Singles === # A Set Howe (2019) # Thu Thet Par Kwel (with Kyoe Kyar, 2020) # Kyal Pyout Nya (with Sone Thin Par, 2021) # Ma Mae Naing (2023) == Personal life == Phyo Gyi has a sister named Yuzana, who is also a singer. == References == Category:1979 births Category:Living people Category:Burmese singers Category:Burmese musicians Category:Burmese singer- songwriters Category:Pop singers Category:People from Yangon
title: Phyo Gyi
